# systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler { #cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler }

```python
systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler(nx, nu)
```

Manages multiple equilibrium points for a dynamical system.

Stores equilibria as backend-neutral NumPy arrays and provides
conversion to any backend on demand.

## Attributes

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [nu](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.nu) | Number of controls |
| [nx](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.nx) | Number of states |

## Methods

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| [add](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.add) | Add named equilibrium point. |
| [get_both](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.get_both) | Get both state and control equilibria |
| [get_metadata](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.get_metadata) | Get metadata for equilibrium |
| [get_u](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.get_u) | Get equilibrium control in specified backend |
| [get_x](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.get_x) | Get equilibrium state in specified backend |
| [list_names](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.list_names) | List all equilibrium names |
| [set_default](#cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.set_default) | Set default equilibrium |

### add { #cdesym.systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.add }

```python
systems.base.utils.EquilibriumHandler.add(
    name,
    x_eq,
    u_eq,
    verify_fn=None,
    tol=1e-06,
    **metadata,
)
```

Add named equilibrium point.

Args:
    name: Equilibrium name
    x_eq: Equilibrium state
    u_eq: Equilibrium control
    verify_fn: Optional function(x, u) -> dx to verify equilibrium
    tol: Tolerance for verification
    **metadata: Additional info (stability, description, etc.)
